blogs.title: Transform customer self-service with text to speech

content.html:
Interactive Voice Response (IVR) gives callers an engaging way to resolve their issues. Each caller can choose an option by pressing-1, 2, and 3.

In the past, text to speech software sounded too robotic and pronunciation was inaccurate.

Now, text to speech is a viable way to automate customer service as the voices sound more clear and more similar to the human voice. Customers can now hear the vital information they need.

Combining IVR and text to speech (TTS) lets businesses provide customers with around the clock support. It gives callers access to information anytime, anywhere and in multiple languages. This lowers operation costs for businesses by reducing agent calls, improve call routing and customer satisfaction.

IVR is not just used for calling. It can be useful to visually impaired users when accessing web apps. Companies can provide text to speech in their chat bots in multiple languages. Most chatbots give text as prompts, but with TTS, a business can improve customer engagement and reach a new audience.

Verby's text to speech web app is free for commercial use starting on our basic voices. Simply type and paste your text in the text area. Save as your preferred file name and click Download. Then you can use the generated mp3 file and upload them to your IVR system. Although Verby does not provide a turn-key IVR system, its text to speech conversion could be used with your existing legacy IVR systems by replacing your old recordings with the generated mp3 voices. A new generation turn-key IVR system is already in the market.

blogs.slogan: Your current IVR system is outdated. Text to speech can breath it new life and customers will love it.
